text: Jeffrey Harold Brotman (September 27, 1942 â€“ August 1, 2017) was an American attorney and businessman. He was the co-founder and chairman of Costco Wholesale Corporation. Brotman served on the boards of several public companies andBrotman Bio Forbes accessed March 1, 2012 according to Businessweek magazine is "connected to 13 board members" Business week on Brotman Businessweek, accessed March 1, 2012Jeffrey Brotman Executive Profile Businessweek, retrieved March 4, 2012 and sat on the Board of Directors of the Million-Dollar Roundtable at the United Way of King County.Jeffrey H. Brotman Market Watch, retrieved March 4, 2012 Brotman was born in Tacoma, Washington. He was raised with a Jewish family.History Link: "Brotman, Jeffrey H. (b. 1942) and Susan R. (b. 1949)" retrieved August 28, 2015 Brotman studied at the University of Washington. In 1976, he married Susan Thrailkill. They had two children. Brotman died on August 1, 2017 in Medina, Washington at the age of 74. ==References== Category:1943 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Businesspeople from Tacoma, Washington Category:American Jews Category:Lawyers from Washington (state) Category:American philanthropists Category:Jewish businesspeople Category:Jewish lawyers Category:Jewish philanthropists
title: Jeffrey Brotman
